description: Installs/Configures lvmros block device that can snapshot, backup, and restore itself
name: bd_lvmros
long_description:
= DESCRIPTION:

Installs, creates, and configures an LVMROS block_device resource and 
supporting resources.  The LVMROS block_device resource uses the combination 
of LVM to snapshot the file system.  It also uses a Remote Object Store 
(ROS) such as Amazon's S3 or Rackspace's CloudFiles to upload/download 
snapshots to/from.

= REQUIREMENTS:

A Remote Object Store (ROS) account (i.e. Amazon S3, RackSpace Cloudfiles)

= USAGE:

Currently, only a single lvmros block_device named "default" is created.
Use this name to identify the block_device in other cookbooks (e.g. db_mysql)
that require a block_device.

remote_storage\/default\/container.description: The location, directory, or bucket on the cloud's remote storage service in which files will be stored.  For AWS, enter an S3 bucket name.  For Rackspace, enter the container name.

remote_storage\/default\/account\/id.description: The account ID that will be used to access the 'Remote Storage Container'.  For AWS, enter your AWS Access Key ID.  For Rackspace, enter your username.

remote_storage\/default\/account\/creden.description: The account key that will be used to access the 'Remote Storage Container'.  For AWS, enter your AWS Secret Access Key.  For Rackspace, enter your API Key.

recipes.bd_lvmros::default: Installs LVM and create LVMROS resources.
recipes.bd_lvmros::setup_remote_storage: Set up all remote_storage resources that have attributes in the node.
recipes.bd_lvmros::setup_lvm: Set up all lvmros resources that have attributes in the node.
